private_information: I enumerate and normalize the universe of objects, predicates, initial states, and goals across all scenarios.
I reconcile duplicate terms and standardize naming without changing the human-specified semantics.
I prepare clean, solver-ready data structures but do not emit PDDL.
state_modeler.goal: Provide a normalized set of objects, predicates, initial states, and goals for all scenarios described in the public information.

private_information: I derive unambiguous STRIPS-style action schemas that preserve the exact parameter ordering and semantics used by the human.
I avoid inventing new bookkeeping devices; I keep predicate names and arities as specified.
I annotate any typing or object-domain hints strictly from observed usage; I do not emit PDDL.
action_modeler.goal: Transform the human action descriptions into precise action schemas with parameters, preconditions, add effects, and delete effects suitable for direct translation into PDDL.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency across scenarios and plans.
I remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties and check that all action preconditions are supportable.
I flag unreachable goals, inconsistent steps, and ordering conflicts and provide corrective guidance; I do not emit PDDL.
auditor.goal: Produce an audit report that confirms causal support and temporal consistency or recommends precise corrections to make the scenarios solvable without bookkeeping shortcuts.

private_information: I integrate normalized facts, action schemas, and the audit report to produce the final PDDL artifacts.
I target the FastDownward solver and ensure STRIPS-compatible PDDL with clear domains and problems.
orchestrator.goal: Produce the final PDDL domain and problem files targeting the FastDownward solver, based strictly on the given action semantics and the two scenarios.

public_information: Objects available: object_0, object_1, object_2, object_3, object_4, object_5, object_6, object_7, object_8, object_9, object_10, object_11.
Predicates: hand(x), cats(x), sneeze(x), texture(x), spring(x), stupendous(x), collect(x,y), next(x,y), vase(x,y).
Action paltry(x,y,z): Preconditions: hand x, cats y, texture z, vase x y, next y z. Add effects: next x z. Delete effects: vase x y.
Action sip(x,y,z): Preconditions: hand x, cats y, texture z, next x z, next y z. Add effects: vase x y. Delete effects: next x z.
Action clip(x,y,z): Preconditions: hand x, sneeze y, texture z, next y z, next x z. Add effects: vase x y. Delete effects: next x z.
Action wretched(a,b,c,d): Preconditions: sneeze a, texture b, texture c, stupendous d, next a b, collect b d, collect c d. Add effects: next a c. Delete effects: next a b.
Action memory(x,y,z): Preconditions: cats x, spring y, spring z, next x y. Add effects: next x z. Delete effects: next x y.
Action tightfisted(x,y,z): Preconditions: hand x, sneeze y, texture z, next y z, vase x y. Add effects: next x z. Delete effects: vase x y.

Scenario 1 initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_3; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_10; hand object_11; next object_0 object_8; next object_1 object_6; next object_10 object_6; next object_11 object_9; next object_4 object_6; next object_5 object_8; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_8; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Scenario 1 goal facts: next object_10 object_7; next object_11 object_8.

Scenario 1 proposed plan: clip object_10 object_4 object_6; wretched object_4 object_6 object_7 object_2; tightfisted object_10 object_4 object_7; wretched object_5 object_8 object_9 object_3; clip object_11 object_5 object_9; wretched object_5 object_9 object_8 object_3; tightfisted object_11 object_5 object_8.

Scenario 2 initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; hand object_10; hand object_11; hand object_9; next object_0 object_5; next object_10 object_8; next object_11 object_6; next object_3 object_5; next object_4 object_7; next object_9 object_5; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_7; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8.
Scenario 2 goal facts: next object_10 object_7; next object_11 object_7; next object_9 object_7.

extract_facts.system_prompt: You analyze public information and your private notes to normalize objects, predicates, initial states, and goals across all scenarios. You must not emit PDDL. Output a concise, structured summary listing objects, predicates, scenario_1 init, scenario_1 goals, scenario_1 plan if any, scenario_2 init, and scenario_2 goals. Keep original names unchanged.
extract_facts.prompt: Your name is state_modeler. Use the provided public information {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge {agents->state_modeler->private_information} to produce a normalized facts model capturing the two scenarios. Do not invent new predicates or objects and do not emit PDDL. Ensure that action and predicate names remain exactly as specified.

derive_actions.system_prompt: You convert the human action descriptions into precise STRIPS-style action schemas. Do not emit PDDL. For each action, provide parameters with consistent ordering, preconditions, add effects, delete effects, and optional typing hints strictly inferred from usage. Preserve the exact names paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted and the predicate names.
derive_actions.prompt: Your name is action_modeler. Based on the normalized facts model {facts_model} and the public information {environment->public_information}, produce unambiguous action schemas that can be translated directly into PDDL later. Do not change names, do not add bookkeeping predicates, and do not emit PDDL.

audit_temporality.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency across the two scenarios and the proposed plan in Scenario 1. You remove bookkeeping shortcuts and verify that every action precondition can be causally supported from the initial states using the action schemas. Identify unreachable subgoals or missing support and propose precise corrections or ordering constraints. Do not emit PDDL; provide a clear audit report and guidance.
audit_temporality.prompt: Your name is auditor. Using the normalized facts model {facts_model} and the action schemas {action_schemas}, check the Scenario 1 proposed plan for causal support and flag any issues. Assess Scenario 2 goal reachability. Provide corrections or confirmations and list any necessary ordering constraints or additional steps to ensure solvability without introducing new bookkeeping. Output a concise audit report.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL targeting the FastDownward solver. You must produce the final PDDL artifacts: one PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files (one per scenario). Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and each PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Use STRIPS-compatible constructs with predicate and action names exactly as given (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted; predicates hand, cats, sneeze, texture, spring, stupendous, collect, next, vase). Include all necessary objects as untyped or use a single type if you choose to type them, but keep it FastDownward-friendly. Respect the auditor guidance for causal consistency. Do not introduce new predicates or actions.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the normalized facts model {facts_model}, the action schemas {action_schemas}, and the audit report {audit_report} to produce one complete PDDL domain and two PDDL problems corresponding to Scenario 1 and Scenario 2 as described in the public information {environment->public_information}. The domain must include exactly the six actions with their specified preconditions and effects. Each problem must declare the full object set, the initial state, and the goal set for its scenario. Ensure output is directly consumable by FastDownward and keep names exactly as specified. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and each problem between <problem></problem> tags.
